metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8769 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
tcpdump 3.8 through 4.6.2 might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from memory or cause a denial of service (packet loss or segmentation fault) via a crafted Ad hoc On-Demand Distance Vector (AODV) packet, which triggers an out-of-bounds memory access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8769` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

tcpdump - 4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tcpdump package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.5.1-2ubuntu1.1').
